circumstances: Aimee Walker, known to avoid authorities and having spoken of disappearing on several occasions, vanished from her home at 71 Lothian Crescent, Dundee. She left no indication of her intended destination. Her brother, aware of her interest in non-conventional living, speculated that she may have possibly joined a commune. Aimee was traced to Auldbar Road, Forfar by police, but prior to that, she was allegedly seen near 28 Railton Gardens, Arbroath. Friends reported her visit to St Mary's Lane, Newport-on-Tay, but details remain sketchy. Despite the search effort, her propensity for evading detection and desire for solitude contributed significantly to her short-lived disappearance.
